text: Ludwig van Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 21 in C major, Op. 53, also known as the Waldstein is a piece of music for solo piano. It was written in the summer of 1804 for Count Ferdinand Ernst Joseph Gabriel von Waldstein. Tovey, D.F. (1931) Commentary on Beethoven's Piano Sonatas, London, ABRSM.Ball, P. (2010) The Music Instinct, London, The Bodley Head ==Form== The sonata is in three sections, called movements: ==References== Piano Sonata 021 Category:Compositions in C major
title: Piano Sonata No. 21 (Beethoven)
